title: Accidentally clicked the Share Phone app on my Pixel 2 and now I don't have access to most apps
content:
Hi,
While cleaning up my installed apps, I clicked on the Share Phone app to see what it was. Apparently, I had set this up some time back with very restricted permissions and had forgotten all about it. Now I cannot use almost any app on my phone (I can browse the list of apps, open the Files app, but that's about it). 
I tried locking my phone and re-entering my passcode, restarting with no luck.
Does anyone know how to disable the restrictions so I can get full access to my phone?

Thanks a lot in advance.
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 2
